events.name: April PowerShell UG meetup
events.description: Hi, Would like to invite you for April PowerShell UG meetup. We will host Jakub Jares (remotely) he will talk about Pester. I am Jakub, I am a one of the owners of the Pester project, and I've been doing testing in PowerShell since before it was cool. I have several years of administrative experience mostly in banking environment, where I discovered Pester and started using it to test my own projects. Two years ago I moved to development, and so I can hopefully offer insight from the admin as well as developer point of view. I am also a Microsoft MVP for the past 3 years. Introduction to Pester. This session will teach you how to start testing with Pester. We will have a look on the basic principles, of automated testing and how to apply them with Pester. We will go through some of the basic errors and and how to avoid them. And we will have a look on how Pester fits in the big picture and how others are using it. Our second session will be about DSC Using scripts and DSC to set up a virtual lab environment. I plan to demo to use a single fresh PC and turn it into a functional virtual LAB with several functional VMs to be used for research or testing. Faster and cheaper than you could do on Azure. I will show various tips and tricks during the demo. Bio: Peter is working with Microsoft technologies since the early 1990s. As an application developer he created mostly web based business solutions since 1996. Working primarily in small companies he often has to work with the full stack, from installing and maintaining servers and databases to back-end programming and client side code.Peter is using PowerShell since his scripts still had *.msh extensions in 2005.He is currently traveling around the world avoiding planes and does some consulting work on the way.Peter is active on several stackexchange.com sites, maintains a few open source projects and very seldom speaks at user group meetings. He sometimes blogs about how he solved problems he encountered. April meetup looking very good, hope to see many of our members joining us. Sebastian
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 22, Meeting Room

events.name: Sunday Showcase: Infinite 2017
events.description:
Sunday Showcase: Infinite 2017
Saturday & Sunday, 8 & 9 April | 10am - 7pm
ArtScience Galleries, Level 4
Free. Register in the Lobby 

Infinite 2017 is an interactive showcase of projects by graduating students from the School of InfoComm Technology, Ngee Ann Polytechnic. Illustrating the infinite possibilities of digital media when creative ideas and IT collide, get a glimpse of future technologies as students share their innovations in areas of games, apps, virtual and augmented reality, and animation. The future is infinite!
